com.stremebase.base

Class DB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stremebase.base.DB

  • public class DB
extends Object
    DB is the class for controlling various configuration parameters. If Stremebase is started by calling startDB(boolean persist), default values are used. You can overrride default values with an inherited DB where you set the values in a custom constructor and then calling startDB(DB dataBase, boolean persist) with it.

    At runtime, the singleton instance can be accessed from db. Never modify it.

    • Field Detail

      • DIRECTORY

        public final String DIRECTORY
        Defines the folder where data is saved (if not in in-memory mode).

        Default: new File(System.getProperty("user.dir")+File.separatorChar+"db"+File.separatorChar)

      • KEYSTOAKEYFILE

        public final long KEYSTOAKEYFILE
        How many keys are included in one key file. Optimal value depends at least on density of your keys, your data access patterns, size of your RAM and speed of your HD. Basically, if keys run sequentially (as they should), the bigger the better.

        Default: 1000000

      • INITIALVALUEFILESIZE

        public final long INITIALVALUEFILESIZE
        The start size for files that store data values. Every time new file is needed, the size id doubled, until MAXVALUEFILESIZE is reached. Optimal value depends at least on size and quantity of your data values, size of your RAM and speed of your HD. Basically, if there's plenty of RAM, the bigger the better.

        Default: 10000000

      • MAXVALUEFILESIZE

        public final long MAXVALUEFILESIZE
        The maximum size for files that store data values - unless a single value needs more space. Optimal size depends at least on the quantity of different properties, your data access patterns, and size of your RAM. If any file is bigger than your free off-heap RAM: disaster.

        Default: 64 * INITIALVALUEFILESIZE

      • MAXCACHEDFREESLOTS

        public final int MAXCACHEDFREESLOTS
        The maximum number of deleted value slots that is remembered. The smaller the value, the less on-heap memory is lost. If the value is too small, some deleted slots are not recorded, which will leave gaps in files, which eats your HD space.

        Default: 100000

      • MAXCACHEDSETSIZE

        public final int MAXCACHEDSETSIZE
        The maximum number of modified set values that are cached on-heap before written to off-heap. Writing to off-heap requires ordering the values, which is slow. Therefore modifications are cached until there's a read operation, MAXCACHEDSETSIZE is hit, or java heap size becomes scarce.

        Default: 100000

      • ZONE

        public final ZoneId ZONE
        The wildcard character that represents zero or more arbitrary characters at the end of word. (% in SQL).

        Default: * (asterisk) see stremebase.property.api.Text#getKeysContainingWords(CharSequence... words)

      • NOINDEX

        public static final int NOINDEX
        This map constructor parameter tells that the map is not to be indexed.
        See Also:
        LongMap.LongMap(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • SIMPLEINDEX

        public static final int SIMPLEINDEX
        This map constructor parameter tells that the map will be indexed and multiple values per key are not allowed.
        See Also:
        LongMap.LongMap(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • MULTIINDEX

        public static final int MULTIINDEX
        This map constructor parameter tells that the map will be indexed and multiple values per key are counted.
        See Also:
        LongMap.LongMap(java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • NULL

        public static final long NULL
        A constant indicating that the value is missing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fileManager

        public static final com.stremebase.file.FileManager fileManager
        The singleton FileManager instance. For internal use.

      • db

        public static DB db
        Access to the singleton DB instance at run-time. For internal use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DB

        public DB()
        Constructor where all final parameters are set.

    • Method Detail

      • isPersisted

        public static boolean isPersisted()
        Check whether database was started in persisted or in in-memory mode.
        Returns:
        true, if data is persisted to disk.

      • startDB

        public static void startDB(boolean persist)
        Starts Stremebase with default parameter values.
        Parameters:
        persist - Set to true, if you want a true persisted database. Set to false, if you want an in-memory database.

      • startDB

        public static void startDB(DB dataBase,
                           boolean persist)
        Starts Stremebase with custom settings (for advanced users).
        Parameters:
        dataBase - DB with parameter values that are optimized for your application and hardware.
        persist - Set to true, if you want a true persisted database. Set to false, if you want an in-memory database.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Forces flushing of all memory-mapped files to disk. A shutdown hook is set that will automatically call this, so you don't need to.

      • close

        public void close()
        Stores information about free spaces in files to disk. A shutdown hook is set that will automatically call this, so you don't need to.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Deletes all data, aka Drop Database.
